name: Amazon Interview Preparation Timetable
values: Deep dive into all 16 LPs. Prepare advanced STAR stories, focusing on specific Amazon scenarios and quantifiable impact. Review common behavioral questions.
Practice complex tree problems (e.g., Red-Black Trees, AVL Trees, Segment Trees, Trie). Focus on optimal time/space complexity and edge cases.
Design a highly available and scalable service (e.g., a distributed cache, a notification system). Focus on components, trade-offs, consistency models, and fault tolerance.
Refine STAR stories for challenging behavioral questions, specifically around handling conflict, dealing with failure, and taking calculated risks. Emphasize advanced self-reflection.
Tackle hard Dynamic Programming and Backtracking problems. Understand memoization vs. tabulation, state space optimization, and common patterns.
Focus on designing robust RESTful APIs, understanding microservice communication patterns (sync/async), and managing data consistency across distributed services.
Conduct a full mock interview with a peer or mentor, including a hard coding problem and 3-4 Amazon Leadership Principle questions. Get detailed feedback.
Master advanced graph algorithms (e.g., Dijkstra's, Floyd-Warshall, MSTs, Topological Sort). Practice real-world applications and variations.
Review different database types (SQL, NoSQL, NewSQL) and their use cases in large-scale systems. Discuss sharding, replication, and indexing strategies.
Identify and review any remaining weak areas across coding, system design, and behavioral topics. Practice quick problem-solving and LP story recall.
